page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: Older houses in the area are stone- built,having been erected when Pudsey played an important part in the woollen industry.Many houses,terraced, semi-detached and detached,have been stone-cleaned.Others have been left, their owners feeling that cleaning them would rob them of character and part of their history. Newer housing is both council and privately owned.Most of the council houses are semi-detached with private gardens.There are a few blocks of flats and maisonettes.The private houses built most recently tend to be in small developments.Most can be found in the north-west of the block. One of the most interesting building trends is the renewal of old areas. {Booth's Yard,}built in the 1700's,has been given a new lease of life as a tourist attraction in the town-centre.
